titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the John M. Donaldson papers, 1873-1938, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Rihoko Ueno

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:02:22 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The papers of Detroit-based architect John M. Donaldson measures 0.11 linear feet and consists of 31 items that date from 1873 to 1938. The papers include a letter from Frank Duveneck, 1877; a sketch of Donaldson, ca. 1876, by [James] Carroll Beckwith, alongside a note from Beckwith, 1913; letters from Gari Melchers, some of which are illustrated; obituary clippings on Melchers; photographs in the form of carte de visites, mostly of fellow art students in Munich, 1873-1877, including Francis Davis Millet and Frank Duveneck; and miscellany. Also included are several letters from Gari Melchers's wife Corrine to Donaldson's son, Bruce.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection the papers are arranged as one series.

list.item: Series 1: John M. Donaldson papers, 1873-1938 (Folder 1, OV 2; 31 items)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John M. Donaldson (1854-1941) was an architect based in Detroit, Michigan. Donaldson was a friend of painter Gari Melchers. Donaldson's son Bruce (d. 1940) was chairman of the Art History Department at the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Portions of the collection are available on 35mm microfilm reel D160 at the Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan. Researchers should note that the arrangement of material described in the container inventory does not reflect the arrangement of the collection on microfilm.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The John M. Donaldson papers were donated to the Archives of American Art in 1963 by Mrs. Alex G. Donaldson.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John M. Donaldson papers, 1873-1938. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Rihoko Ueno in 2020.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Also found in the Archives of American Art are the Bruce M. Donaldson letters from Gari Melchers, 1928 May 9 and May 22.
